entry.title: leandronsp/agostinho
entry.summary:
Uma versão Ruby bastante modesta da rinha de backend 2ª edição 2024/Q1

agostinho

   __    ___  _____  ___  ____  ____  _  _  _   _  _____ 
  /__\  / __)(  _  )/ __)(_  _)(_  _)( \( )( )_( )(  _  )
 /(__)\( (_-. )(_)( \__ \  )(   _)(_  )  (  ) _ (  )(_)( 
(__)(__)\___/(_____)(___/ (__) (____)(_)\_)(_) (_)(_____)

Uma versão Ruby bastante modesta da rinha do backend 2ª edição 2024/Q1

Requisitos

  • Docker
  • Gatling, a performance testing tool
  • Make (optional)

Stack

  • 2 Ruby 3.3 +YJIT apps
  • 1 PostgreSQL
  • 1 NGINX

Ruby é lento????? So far, so good

Usage

$ make help

Usage: make <target>
  help                       Prints available commands
  start.dev                  Start the rinha in Dev
  start.prod                 Start the rinha in Prod
  docker.stats               Show docker stats
  health.check               Check the stack is healthy
  stress.it                  Run stress tests
  docker.build               Build the docker image
  docker.push                Push the docker image

Inicializando a aplicação

$ docker compose up -d nginx

# Ou então utilizando Make...
$ make start.dev

Testando a app:

$ curl -v http://localhost:9999/clientes/1/extrato

# Ou então utilizando Make...
$ make health.check

Unleash the madness

Colocando Gatling no barulho:

$ make stress.it 
$ open stress-test/user-files/results/**/index.html

ASCII art generator

entry.title: era7bio/md2pdf
entry.summary:
a wrapper around pandoc for converting markdown to pdf

md2pdf

A wrapper around pandoc for producing PDFs from markdown files; it relies on one of our pandoc templates for doing it.

install

This is a conscript app, so

# is that easy:
cs era7bio/md2pdf

important md2pdf assumes that you have a xelatex default.tex template under your pandoc datadir. If you use our pandoc datadir, you're all set :)

use

just type md2pdf and you'll see a usage message.
